channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WV

item.title: Report E-2023120322
item.description:
Report E-2023120322

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-16
  • City: PARKERSBURG
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 16, 2023, at approximately 14:24 hours, personnel at the CSX Parkersburg, WV yard reported an odor of gas coming from the area of tank TILX 305535, residue: last contained Isoprene, stabilized. SPSI, a CSXT response contractor, responded and found TILX 305535 leaking from the top of the tank car. The tank car was isolated and the Shipper, Kraton Corp, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2023-1216-00057). SPSI inspected the railcar and found the sample line valve not fully closed and the secondary closure plug less than tool tight. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative- Kel Fann (904-239-2238, Michael.Fann@kraton.com). Contractor personnel closed the sample line valve and secured the secondary closure plug. The car was released for transportation.
